alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 6:23AM PDT until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Forecast flooding for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. .Steady light to moderate rains will fall across the watershed through Saturday with the potential for another inch of rain. This combined with ongoing snow melt will result in increased runoff into the Okanogan River. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring this morning. Moderate flooding is forecast Saturday afternoon. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.8 feet, Water covers part of Highway 21 near the intersection with Little Goosmus Creek Road between mile post 185 and 189. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM PDT Friday the stage was 18.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 AM PDT Friday was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.8 feet late Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.9 feet on 06/01/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/spokane. The next statement will be issued by Friday afternoon or as updates become available.this evening at 630 PM PDT.
